resource_data:

  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086724</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">"People we can get along without."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">"Leute, die wir entlang außen erhalten können."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">les "gens que nous pouvons obtenir le long en 
dehors."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">"povos que nós podemos começar longitudinalmente
without."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">"la gente che possiamo ottenere avanti senza."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">"Ανθρωποι μπορούμε να παρουσιάσουμε πρόοδο χωρίς."</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">"gente que podemos conseguir adelante fuera."</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Between 1910 and 1920, 500,000 African Americans left the South for northern cities, pulled by the promise of jobs in booming wartime industries and pushed by disfranchisement, poverty, racial violence, and lack of educational opportunities. The Great Migration" placed a strain on cities like Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Zwischen 1910 und 1920 ließen 500.000 afrikanische 
Amerikaner den Süden für Nordstädte, gezogen durch die Versprechung
von Jobs in dröhnenden Kriegindustrien und durch disfranchisement, 
Armut, rassische Gewalttätigkeit und Mangel an pädagogischen 
Gelegenheiten gedrückt. Die große Migration "plazierte eine 
Belastung auf Städte wie Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Entre 1910 et 1920, 500.000 Américains africains ont 
laissé les Sud pour les villes nordiques, tirés par la 
promesse des travaux dans des industries éclatantes de temps de 
guerre et poussés par disfranchisement, pauvreté, violence raciale, 
et manque d'occasions éducatives. Le grand transfert "a placé 
une contrainte sur des villes comme Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Entre 1910 e 1920, 500.000 americanos africanos deixaram o
sul para cidades do norte, puxado pela promessa dos trabalhos em 
indústrias crescendo do wartime e empurrado pelo disfranchisement, 
pela pobreza, pela violência racial, e pela falta de oportunidades 
educacionais. A migração grande "colocou uma tensão em 
cidades como Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Fra 1910 e 1920, 500.000 Americani africani hanno lasciato
il sud per le città nordiche, tirato dalla promessa dei lavori nelle 
industrie crescenti di wartime e spinto dal disfranchisement, dalla 
povertà, dalla violenza razziale e dalla mancanza di occasioni 
educative. L'espansione grande "ha disposto uno sforzo sulle 
città come Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Μεταξύ 1910 και 1920, 500.000 αφρικανικοί 
Αμερικανοί άφησαν το νότο για τις βόρειες πόλεις, που τραβηκαν 
από την υπόσχεση των εργασιών στις βουίζοντας εν καιρώ πολέμου 
βιομηχανίες και που ωθήθηκαν από το disfranchisement, την 
ένδεια, τη φυλετική βία, και την έλλειψη εκπαιδευτικών 
ευκαιριών. Η μεγάλη μετανάστευση "τοποθέτησε μια πίεση στις
πόλεις όπως το Σικάγο</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Entre 1910 y 1920, 500.000 americanos africanos dejaron el
sur para las ciudades norteñas, tirado por la promesa de trabajos en 
industrias del tiempo de guerra que crecían y empujado por el 
disfranchisement, la pobreza, la violencia racial, y la carencia de 
oportunidades educativas. La gran migración "puso una tensión 
en ciudades como Chicago</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Sciences humaines</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Studi umanistici</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ανθρωπότητες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Humanidad</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <lifeCycle>
          <contribute>
            <role>
              <source>roleValues</source>
              <value>author</value>
            </role>

FN:CENTER FOR HISTORY AND NEW MEDIA/AMERICAN SOCIAL HISTORY PROJECT
VERSION:3.0
END:VCARD</entity>
          </contribute>
        </lifeCycle>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1765086724</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>

        </educational>
        <rights>

            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>no</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

            <string language="en">No License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
